bug.short_desc: Script compilation within root broken with libstdc++-devel-6.0.0-0.12.fc24.x86_64

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Compilation of scripts within root is broken
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
root-5.34.32-8.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a simple root script, e.g. the following as hello.C
#include <iostream> void hello() { std::cout << "hello, world!" << endl; }
2. .L hello.C++

Expected results:
Should create a shared library with a function hello, which can be called from the command line. Works fine on Fedora 23 with libstdc++-devel-5.3.1-2.fc23.x86_64.
Additional info:
Alternatively, with rootcint and an empty LinkDef.h > LinkDef.h rootcint -f test.C -c -p LinkDef.h
gives the same messages. Note that removing the -p seems to work (i.e. using root's own preprocessor rather than the compiler's).
